title: Pride
fandoms: Keeper of the Lost Cities Series - Shannon Messenger
warnings: Choose Not To Use Archive Warnings, No Archive Warnings Apply
post_title:
Marella Redeck was different. She looked at the world differently. But the world looked back at her with hatred. A long story short, Marella had a crush on someone.
*PRIDE*
Hello all in the LGBTQ+ community I wanted to sho my support and this is the best way I know how
Those who don't like the LGBTQ+ community this fanfiction is not for you
ENJOY
comment:
Marella Redeck was different. She looked at the world differently. But the world looked back at her with hatred. A long story short, Marella had a crush on someone.
—-----
She walked out of her lesson with Fintan tiredly.
“How do I summon Everblaze?” She had asked,
“You don’t, it calls for you.” Fintan had responded.
She leaped to Choralmere where Linh was still staying. A hot tug kept pulling her. She did her best to ignore it but it was like ignoring getting stabbed. Linh opened the door with a smile and headed out to meet her.
“Hey Mare.” Linh said,
She was the one person who could call her that.
“Hi Linh.” She replied.
Marella felt her cheeks warm. But before anyone could say anything else, Marella collapsed under the pressure of the hot tug. She was no longer in control; fire was. Before she knew it her hand was raised and yellow-white fire came down to her. Linh screamed and started gathering water. Quan and Mai Song threw frissin on the fire putting it out. But the fire was resilient and it came back time and time again.
“MARELLA!” Linh screamed as her parents tried to drag her away.
Marella would have responded but she wasn’t Marella anymore all that was there was fire.
Linh pulled out of her parents grasps and ran straight into the fire using her water to protect her. Marella was in the center of the blaze fighting for control of her ability.
“Marella.” Linh said through a coughing fit. Smoke inhalation. “Calm the blaze.”
“I can’t!” Marella weeped.
Linh walked closer to her, “Yes you can. You're Marella freaking Redek and you can do this!”
When Marella tried again and failed Linh got her heaving deep breaths.
“In and out Mare, in and out.” She coaxed.
When Marella tried again the Everblaze stopped. The fires went out with only a small trace that they were ever there.
“Efflorescence.” Linh breathed,
In the center of the efflorescence was a tall red and blue flower. Colors overlapping in an array of petals. Marella sighed in relief and wonder.
“Thank you.” She told Linh.
“It was all you, Mare.” Linh told her.
Marella shook her head in defeat. She breathed in deeply, enjoying the scented air. Linh stood by her wrapping her in a quick hug.
“I… .” Marella tried to say,
“What?” Linh said, tilting her head to the side.
“I…love you.” She said, the latter as quiet as a single slow drop of water in a hurricane.
“Marella I couldn’t hear you.” Linh pointed out.
“I love you.” Marella said again louder and faster.
“I love you too, Mare.”
“No like love love you.”
“I do too.”
Marella looked at Linh in a new light.
“You love me.” She squeaked,
Linh nodded, “I worried you wouldn't feel the same so I didn’t say anything.”
Marella laughed in joy. Their hands came together and they smiled. Some wouldn't accept them. And that’s just natural but that wouldn't stop them for acting on their emotions.
writing_prompt: When Marella's uncontrollable fire abilities threaten to consume everything around her, only Linh's calm determination can bring her back—but in the aftermath of the blaze, a confession ignites a different kind of flame between them.

title: How Far Will You Go (And How Deep Will You Fall)
warnings: Major Character Death, No Archive Warnings Apply
post_title: One-shot au where once the Titan is no longer powering Luz she dies (again) but she comes to terms with it.
comment:
Luz knew from the second she accepted the Titan’s power she wouldn't be back forever. A sharp pang of guilt hit her when she called out that she was back when she appeared back in the spot where she had died the first time. And every time the pattern in her chest flickered slightly it was a reminder that she would fall back down in the In Between. She knew it would be painful for her, and everyone she left behind. But it would be worth it.. …. . Right? To stop Belos and save the Isles. She had to do this. Did she? If she had never followed Owlbert through the portal on that summer morning none of this would have ever happened. She knew that. It was a thought that plagued her mind every single time she woke up while they were trapped in the human realm. Followed by the thought of “You could end this all. All you need is a knife, or rope, or deep water.” She hadn’t told anyone she had thought of taking her life. Better to hide behind an illusion of contentment. But Hunter saw it. He saw it every time she pretended things were normal. Because he felt guilty too. Her fault as well.
But something smacked her in the face in this downward spiral. Hunter wouldn't exist if she hadn’t come to the Boiling Isles. Amity would still be wrapped around her mothers finger. Willow would've never switched to the plant track. Gus (technically Agustus if she had just gone to camp) would be forever doubting himself with Willow as his only friend (and vice versa). Vee would still be trapped, she wouldn't be able to run forever. Matt would think he still had to prove himself. Eda would’ve never opened up. King would keep living in denial. And the Collector, they would still be trapped with no way out (a fate he never deserved). The magic mixers (Jerbo, Viney and Barcus) would still be in the detention track. Luz smiled as she was lifted to the air, the Titan’s power starting to leave her body.
“Eda, King, thank you for being a part of my life.” Luz said, before the Titan’s spirit moved on and so did she.
Death was much more pleasant this time around. And she even smiled when she hit the strangely warm water in the In Between. She closed her eyes letting a few tears loose as she left the realm she loved. No one to pull her out of the water: she sank.
Luz’s eyes opened as she felt warmth. Not the all consuming warmth of the water but of love and the good feelings Luz missed. She looked in front of her.
“D…. Dad?” She said not quite believing it.
“Hi Little Light.” Manny said, opening his arms toward her.
Luz ran towards him. A lifetime's worth of hug in one embrace. Luz cried happily wrapped in her father’s warm hug.
“You did so good Luz. My good witch.” He said right in her ear neither breaking the hug.
Luz agreed for the first time in a very long time. She had saved the realm she loved and the people she loved.
“Are you ready?” Manny asked, pulling away and holding out his hand to Luz.
Luz nodded, taking his hand. And the best part was she really was.
writing_prompt: After sacrificing everything to save the ones she loved, Luz finds herself in the In Between, where a familiar face waits to guide her toward peace—but is she truly ready to let go?

title: Reunion
fandoms: Keeper of the Lost Cities Series - Shannon Messenger
warnings: Choose Not To Use Archive Warnings, No Archive Warnings Apply
post_title: When Alvar leaves Candleshade after Sophie and Keefe find him hiding there he goes to meet back up with his little sister.
comment:
Alvar lifted the crystal to the light, a worried feeling came over him as he leaped away.
Biana was out for her morning run, hair in a loose braid that was slowly falling out. Alvar stumbled out of his hiding place readying himself for yelling. As soon asAlvar made eye contact with her Biana glared daggers at him.
“Bee I-” Alvar started
“No,” Biana interrupted, “I’m not falling for your tricks again.”
“I’m not pulling any trick I just–” his sentence was cut off by another coughing fit, “Just wanted to see you.”
Biana’s facial features softened but tensed up again, “Why would you want to see me!” She yelled.
“You're,” another coughing fit he tried again, “You’re my sister.”
Biana’s hair was now fully out of her braid and it blew softly in the wind.
“And you're my brother but you betrayed us.” Biana muttered,
“I never wanted to fight or hurt anyone.. .but it was the only way I could find to help you.”
“Help me?” Biana repeated,
Alvar nodded, “I hated watching you get beat… …. .. .knowing it was partially my fault.”
“How was it your fault?”
Alvar smiled weakly, “Alden knew you were my favorite.”
Biana stumbled back a few steps, shocked, “You're favorite?”
Alvar nodded, “So when I found the Neverseen they promised that their mission would put an end to it. I never wanted to hurt people but it was inevitable.”
Then Biana did something she never thought she would do to him again. She hugged him tightly, “I’m sorry for everything I did Alvar.” She whispered in his ear.
“You did nothing wrong.”
“Yes I did, I let Fitz trap you in there, I let the pod fill.”
“Well in that case I’m sorry too.”
The brother and sister hugged for a few more moments before Tam and Treigan came outside.
Tam immediately glared at Alvar but when Biana smiled at him his scowl faded.
“What’s he doing here Bee?” Tam asked,
“He came to see me.” She answered sweetly,
“But-”
“I’m sorry I’ll-” He coughed again, “I’ll go.”
“No it’s fine you're clearly not well.” Biana protested.
“Would you mind letting Tiergan search your mind?” Tam said still skeptical,
“Of course.” Alvar said,
Triergan closed his eyes and when they opened he said, “Alvar and Biana are telling the truth.”
Biana grinned at Alvar after that. Alvar tried to smile back but he felt faint. He passed out a few moments later.
—---------
When Alvar woke up he saw Elwin hovering over him. Alvar tried to sit up but he couldn't; his arms were too tired. When he turned his head he saw Biana out of the corner of his eye. He smiled.
“Are you sure he’s okay?” Biana asked Elwin as Alvar closed his eyes again.
“Yes Biana he’ll be fine but it may take a while for him to be back at full strength.” Elwin replied.
Alvar heard the door open and two pairs of footsteps walk in.
“Are you kidding me he’s still alive!” Fitz yelled.
“Biana, why do you look so happy?” Sophie asked
“I’ll explain later. Fitz leave him alone.” Biana said
“Why? He betrayed us, why are we helping him!”
Alvar winced, yes he had been eavesdropping; pretending to be asleep but the comments still hurt. Though it was Fitz. Alvar hadn’t cared what Fitz thought for a long time. One sibling cared about him. One sibling forgave him. One sibling still loved him. Biana was the only one he needed.
writing_prompt: A former traitor returns, weak and broken, seeking forgiveness from the sibling who once trusted them most—but not everyone is ready to let the past go.

title: Flying Too Close To The Sun
fandoms: Percy Jackson and the Olympians - Rick Riordan
warnings: Choose Not To Use Archive Warnings, No Archive Warnings Apply
post_title:
Icarus flew too close to the sun, Piper flew into it.
Or,
Piper has a crush, and it ain’t Jason
(Looks back to all the unfinished TOH fanfics, hyperfixations be danged :()
comment:
Piper Mclean was not a shy girl. She had stolen BMVs, fought gods with nothing but a dagger and a pretty voice, and helped defeat the Earth Mother Gaia. She had become head counselor of the Aphrodite cabin easily. She was not shy.
***
After they defeated Gaia, Piper just felt broken. Leo was gone. He couldn’t be dead. He couldn’t.
Even without the grief of losing Leo, she felt… off. She was supposed to be happy… right? She had an awesome boyfriend, friends, she had saved the world. But something was wrong. She didn’t know how to feel. Something was… well.. wrong.
She remembered playing capture the flag with Annabeth. How the daughter of Athena got when she focused. The way blond curls fell down her face. How Piper just wanted to brush them behind her ear. The ruthless way she fought.
She shook her head. No. She was in love with Jason. She wanted to be with him. She remembered how happy she had been when Jason kissed her on that roof… but that was fake. A trick of the Mist, giving her memories that weren’t real.
But no… she did love Jason… she did! But why did she feel… hollow. Empty. Back then she chocked it up to the grief that came from losing Leo.
She thought back to Annabeth. A girl who was confident. Always had a plan. And… no, no, that was silly. Piper was with Jason, Annabeth was with Percy. That was the way it was supposed to be.
Right?
It was constant dumb thoughts like that, that left her reminding herself… that she loved Jason. She
did
.
Aphrodite pushing her… Hera putting false memories in her head.
No, she wanted to be with the son of Jupiter. She
did
, really… right?
Annabeth, confident, beautiful, smart, Annabeth.
But that was just silly,
dumb
thoughts… that was all it was.
She felt more and more empty. It was suffocating, and she wanted out. She imagined this was what it was like for Percy to drown for the first time. It wasn’t… real. It wasn’t. Just grief, a trick, a.. an… she didn’t know.
She didn’t know how to feel, and she hated it. She was a daughter of Aphrodite for the gods’ sake! She… she was the one who was supposed to break hearts.
Annabeth’s hand brushed Piper’s… her heart leapt into her throat.
No
Piper… didn’t love Jason. Not like a girlfriend should anyway. She didn’t… want to be his girlfriend.
Then what did she want?! For as long as she remembered all she had wanted was Jason.. for as long as she had known him.
Aphrodite pushing her… Hera putting false memories in her head.
But… she knew.. she
did
!
Right
?
If she did… Why did she feel empty?
She thought about Annabeth again. Why
always
Annabeth. Someone who…. Someone she
couldn’t
have.
Was that what it was? Knowing she couldn’t have what she wanted… even though her entire life had been giving her what she wanted… she couldn’t have
this
. This. One. Thing.
It felt like a sick joke.
A daughter of Aphrodite stuck on a dumb
crush
. She was supposed to break other people’s hearts… not the other way around.
She broke up with Jason. For what? Annabeth? Someone she could
never
have.
***
Piper McLean was not shy. Until a certain daughter of Athena made her heart leap.
She wasn’t shy until she wanted something she wouldn’t take.
Icarus flew too close to the sun, Piper flew into it.
writing_prompt: Piper McLean has always been confident, always known what she wanted—until she starts questioning everything she thought she felt about Jason, and why her thoughts keep drifting to Annabeth Chase.

title: When Eyes Meet
fandoms: Keeper of the Lost Cities Series - Shannon Messenger
warnings: Choose Not To Use Archive Warnings, No Archive Warnings Apply
post_title: Keefe meets the mysterious new girl
comment:
Keefe was ditching……..again. He had been hiding behind the level four dragon statue and generally just being Keefe. But when he looked outside of the little nook he saw her. The new girl, blue level two uniform shown like a spotlight in the green halls.
“You must be lost.” He called out jumping out of the nook.
“What?” She asked.
Her eyes were brown with flecks of gold on them. Their eyes met and Keefe felt his cheeks grow warm.
“Well,” he started keeping the mask on, “you're either ditching or lost and you're clearly not ditching.”
“Why couldn’t I be ditching?” She challenged.
“Are you ditching?”
“No, what are you doing here?” She asked him. Her voice was soft and timid, Keefe's cheeks grew warm again.
“I ditch whenever I can. Lady Belva has the worst crush on me, I mean I can’t blame her, but it’s still awkward you know.” He paused,
“Plus now I get to meet the mysterious new girl so I’d say ditching paid off.”
She cocked her head at Keefe, studying him slightly and her cheeks grew a pink hue.
“I’m hardly mysterious.” She said still blushing.
“We’ll see. So where are you supposed to be?” He asked, ignoring the burning in his cheeks.
“Alchemy with Lady Galvin.” She answered, then she glared at her wrist.
“Ohh she hated me. She told me to ‘impress her’ so I turned the table to silver. Maybe don’t mention that we're friends.”
Keefe smirked and she blushed.
“So why are you out here?”
“I exploded my elixir.”
Keefe laughed, “Did you do any damage?”
“Only to her cape.”
“Woah woah woah, do you realize how big that is! That cape is her pride and joy! Did she send you to the principal's office?”
“No, she sent me to the Healing Center; some of it got on my wrist.” She glared at her wrist again.
“Shouldn’t you go over there then?”
“Yeah.” She turned white as the words left her mouth.
“Why did you turn as white as the glass?”
“It’s nothing.” She started walking in the other direction.
“Boy are you going the wrong way; follow me.”
Luckily she followed.
“Sophie?” Elwin called as they walked through the door, “I thought I’d have to drag you back here to check on you.”
“I know.” She said as Keefe cocked his head at her.
“What are you doing here Keefe?” Elwin asked when he saw the boy behind the girl, evidently named Sophie.
“Just helping a fellow prodigy.” Keefe replied.
“I see, you had to miss your session to do so.”
“I know,” He said with an exaggerated sigh, “but Sophie needed help so what could I do.”
“Well, take a seat.” He told the two.”
“This looks like an acid burn. How'd you manage that?”
“Umm, a slight accident in my Alchemy session.”
Keefe made explosion-like noises and mimed an explosion then added, “Destroyed Lady Galvin’s cape!”
Elwin laughed, “Wish I could've seen that!”
Sophie glared.
“Sorry, let's get this treated.”
As Elwin fixed the burn he turned to Keefe, “Should I write you a pass.”
He nodded, "What a good idea.”
“Sessions not over for another 30 minutes so I’d walk slow.”
“Oh I can’t leave until I know Sophie’s okay.”
Elwin rolled his eyes and finished up with Sophie, and sent them away. When the reached the halls Keefe turned the corner as Sophie stopped to listen to Elwin’s last remark.
I just met someone incredibly special. Keefe thought, And I can’t wait to see what she does next.
“Then the bell rang and Keefe’s cheeks were red once again.
writing_prompt: A notorious troublemaker skips class to avoid boredom, only to stumble upon the new student who seems out of place—and far more intriguing than he expected.

title: Returning home
fandoms: Keeper of the Lost Cities Series - Shannon Messenger
warnings: Choose Not To Use Archive Warnings, No Archive Warnings Apply
post_title: Keefe comes back to the Lost Cities.
comment:
Keefe leaped to Havenfeild with Sophie, wondering for the millionth time if he should back out.
“Welcome home!” Edaline called from the doorway. “I thought I’d stay outside to watch our new family of gremlins but also to warn you Sophie. Sandor and Grady are up in your room plotting some clever punishments for running away without your bodyguard. And Dex you should go home to face the wrath of Lovise, and wait is that Dex?”
“No Dex leaped home.” Sophie replied as her and Keefe walked to the doorway.
“Keefe is that you?” Edaline asked.
“Yeah,” Keefe fidgeted with the strap of his bag nervously, “Surprise.”
“I’m so glad you're back, we've missed you around here.” Edaline said as she pulled him into a hug.
“R.. . really?”
Edaline nodded, “How are you feeling, do you need to talk about anything, and oh if you're not comfortable talking about some things that's totally okay, but I’m here if you need to talk.”
“Huh,” Keefe cleared his throat a few times but still sounded choked up when he said, “So that's what a mom is supposed to sound like. Good to know.”
Edaline pulled him in harder, enough for him to tease her about letting him breathe.
“You and Foster should have a strangle hugging contest, it's hard to tell who would win but Foster almost knocked me over.”
“Did she now?” Edaline asked as she turned her gaze to Sophie, who was now staring at her shoes like they held the secrets of the universe.
“So.. . what do you need? I baked a fresh ban of mallowmelt this morning–”
“YES PLEASE!” Keefe interrupted Edaline.
“And some bottles of youth right?” Sophie eventually asked.
“THAT WOULD BE AMAZING!!” Keefe said, jumping up and down.
Edaline conjured the treats and Keefe teared up as she did so.
“Okay this is even better than I remembered! I’m never leaving again!” Keefe said after chugging a bottle of youth and eating two slices of mallowmelt.
“Oh really?” Sophie asked, tone teasing.
Keefe didn’t know what to say to that. It was hard to make jokes to change the subject when he couldn’t read Sophie’s emotions.
Luckily Sophie changed the subject.
“So.. . are you going back to Elwin’s or…”
“Mmh I dunno, I never thought about that.” Keefe answered.
“You could stay here, I mean Jolie’s room is open.” Sophie suggested.
“Thanks but I’m pretty sure that the most dangerous place I could be is locked in a house with your dad and Gigantor.”
“We could set you up under the Panakes.” Edaline suddenly piped up. “Sophie used to sleep out there all the time.”
“I remember, but I think I want somewhere without memories attached to it.” Keefe said, trying to ignore the slightly hurt expression that was on Sophie’s face. “What is she thinking? What is she feeling?” Keefe thought
“If I may.” A voice asked, making Keefe jump. It was Flori Sopie’s gnomish bodyguard.
“If you are looking for something new we could set you up a place in the gnomish grove.” Flori suggested.
“Uh sure I’m down for a gnomish slumber party.”
Flori grinned, “I’ll prepare a bed.”
“Well, this is definitely not how I thought today would go.” Keefe said after he finished the last of the mallowmelt.
“Me neither.” Sophie told him.
“I also didn’t plan on forgiving me so quickly, I had multiple scenarios in mind. I even brought the first thing in the bribery one.”
“Bribery? Gifts?” Sophie asked.
“Yeah.” Keefe reached into his bag and pulled out a small stuffed elf plush.
Sophie burst into giggles when he pulled it out.
“I know it's silly but I know you like stuffed animals and I mean look at his little elf face.” Keefe said quickly, making the elf do a little dance.
Sophie giggled again and said, “I love it seriously.”
Keefe almost wanted to smile but he halfheartedly tossed her the elf.
“Good I almost didn’t bring it in case.. .oh Flori’s waiting for me bye.” And he sprinted off leaving Sophie in the golden light of Havenfield.
writing_prompt: After a long time away, Keefe returns to Havenfield, unsure if he’ll be welcomed back. But between Edaline’s warm embrace, Sophie’s teasing, and a gnomish grove sleepover, he starts to wonder if he’s finally found a place to call home.

title: Cobble's Ship Log

post_title:
It's all the title
Hello again Outer Wilds community I apologize for not posting in a while and I hope you enjoy this fic
comment:

Log #1
I guess I should start with the day the loop started but eh I don’t really want to….

After I looked around for a while and found pretty much nothing new (I explored it plenty back when I lived there) And so I dipped and went to see Gabs. writing_prompt: You and a fellow traveler are stuck in a time loop after making "serious eye contact" with an ancient statue. Each reset brings new discoveries, strange encounters, and the growing question: how do you break the loop without breaking the universe?

title: Soulmates
fandoms: Keeper of the Lost Cities Series - Shannon Messenger
warnings: Choose Not To Use Archive Warnings, No Archive Warnings Apply
post_title: Basically what I would have done with the magical moment called the Sokeefe kiss I might keep going with another one similar where they keep their relationship a secret but I dunno.
comment:
Sophie stepped out of the shadows. She had been watching Keefe from behind one of the trees in the gnomish grove.
“Foster?!” Keefe said, startled. He had been drawing, sitting on the roots on a nearby tree.
“Hi.. .Hi Keefe.” Sophie said nervously. She had paced around her room for what had to be hours trying to figure out how to admit to Keefe that she had started liking him more than a friend.
Sophie walked over to sit next to him, but tripped on a root closeby leading Keefe to jump up and grab her before she hit her face flat on the hard dirt.
“Are you okay?” Keefe's obvious concern flooded his voice.
“N….no, thanks though.” Sophie could feel her face slowly turning red.
“Good to see not everything changed while I was gone.” He said mush more cheerful than he had been for the past few days since he came back.
Sophie just nodded as he stood up. The green notebook had fallen off his lap, the one he described as “the hard stuff”, the page that it had fallen on was Sophie’s first cognate practice with Fitz. It had opened on this page before, the moment Sophie had tried to get Keefe’s feelings out by being sneaky and not admitting her own.
Keefe hadn’t noticed and just asked her if she wanted to take a walk. When she nodded he grabbed her hand Sophie’s face burned as bright as the sun as she felt his warm hand against hers. Keefe led her to a beautiful part of the grove, shimmering lights coming from the plants around them.
“Wow..” Sophie said awestruck.
“Did you know this was here?”
“No but Flori mentioned it. She was trying to get Sandor to bring Griezel here for a date, since it's so romantic.” She didn’t realize her slip until she saw Keefe’s face turning red.
“I am glad I got to come here with you.” Sophie added maybe a little a little too quickly.
She knew she had to get it out before anymore embarrassment or clumsiness stopped her.
So she took a deep breath and started, “I know you said you got over a lot of things when you left. And maybe that includes what you told me in your note. But I just started to realize how much I care about you, and it makes me sad if it is true. That you don’t like me in that way anymore. Because it means I missed my chance to be with this really awesome guy that makes me laugh, and doesn't care if I make a few mistakes. And it's fine I don’t want to guilt you into liking me again, I just needed to tell you.”
She’s done it and it was terrifying. But also so relieving.
“Sophie.” Keefe said as her gaze met his, “You do realize that this could get very messy.”
“Because I’m unmatchable?”
“No, the Council can feed their lists to the gorgodon for all I care. But I wasn’t lying when I told you that my mom could use anything I care about, or anyone I care about, to get to me.”
“I know, but I’m pretty sure I’m already on your mom's list of targets, plus I’m ready for her.” She removed her hand from Keefe’s and reached back to pat Hope’s holster, but Keefe grabbed her hand back before she could touch it and cradled it in his.
“I’m afraid.. . that might not be enough.”
“We’ll make it enough. But if you think that's the only reason.”
“It’s not. Do you want me to list off all the complications?”
Sophie shook her head, “All I care about is how you feel, if you’re only doing this,” She gestured toward their hands which had been intertwined again, “ because you don’t want to hurt my feelings—”
“Trust me this is all I’ve wanted since I first saw you wandering the halls in the middle of session. I knew right then I had met someone incredibly special and that has proven to be true every moment I spend with you.”
Sophie didn’t know how to respond, her mind filled with too many promises, confessions, and complications. That didn’t seem like enough and like too much. So she lifted her head tilting her toes up to line her lips with his. Leaving a tiny wisp of space, a small chance for him to change his mind. Keefe closed the distance between them and everything became new. The soft press of their lips, to the way their breaths seemed to fall perfectly in sync. He pulled away after what felt like too long yet too short. Leaning back to study her.
“No regrets right?” He asked somehow, filled with awe and worry.
“Absolutely none.” She said smiling, his relieved smile was the cutest and sweetest thing she had ever seen, but it faded a little as he said.
“I can’t mess this up, don’t let me mess this up.”
“I won’t.” She assured him as she tilted up to steal one more quick kiss.
writing_prompt: In a quiet, magical grove filled with shimmering lights, Sophie finally gathers the courage to confess her feelings to Keefe, but his fears of danger and complications threaten to stand in the way. How do they navigate the risks of love in a world full of peril?

title: Scars To The Beautiful
fandoms: Keeper of the Lost Cities Series - Shannon Messenger
warnings: Choose Not To Use Archive Warnings, No Archive Warnings Apply
post_title:
Biana is neglected her family doesn't care enough and her friends are only with her to get to Fitz this causes severe depression that she struggles with daily until she get the help she needs
ALL OF YOU WHO ARE HURTING!
You are not alone people care you are amazing and special and brilliant! Get the help you need!
comment:
Biana came home crying not that anyone would notice. Her father Alden was working with Fitz on something and her mother Della was too busy spying on her father for the Council. No one really cared about Biana. When she came to them they told her to go away. Fitz would call her a crybaby. Alden would pay her no mind. And Della would do the worst. She would chat with Biana but never really listened to her.
She ran up to her room. Another person, another one! Revealed that they only wanted to be friends with Biana because she was related to Fitz.
“I’m not worth anything.” A voice inside her head whispered. “No one would want to be with me.”
Biana pressed her head against her pillow trying to silence the voice.
“I’m not beautiful. I’m a mistake.”
Biana screamed and threw her heels into the wall.
“No matter how hard you try, no one will love you or care for you.” The voice continued to answer. Biana jumped up and ran. She ran outside of the house and ran laps around it. Running had been the only thing that stopped the voices. Leaving her too exhausted to think.
She walked back inside. She went to the pantry and grabbed some Prattles. No one invited her down for dinner as per usual. Biana walked to her room and just munched on Prattles. She set the box down on her nightstand and got started on changing. She threw off her sweaty uniform and pulled on a plain black tunic and her softest gray leggings. She skipped her shower and just got into bed. Tears leaked back down her face. She heard the rest of her family eating dinner and no one remembered the youngest Vacker.
“They will never love you.” The voice crept back in.
Biana woke and groaned. It was Saturday she was stuck in Everglen. She didn’t have any friends besides the ones who just wanted a look at her brother. She pulled on a teal tunic with flower embroidery and kept her gray leggins on. She didn’t bother to do her hair.
“Morning sweetie!” Della sang.
Biana shrugged and made herself a breakfast salad. Fitz walked down and said nothing to Biana. He just grabbed a single piece of fruit then leaped away. Alden came down next but again said nothing to Biana, grabbed a single piece of fruit and went back to his office.
Biana started hearing the voice again, “You’re worthless. You're ugly.” Biana pressed her hands to her ears and dropped the knife she was using to cut the fruit. Della pid it no mind. Biana crouched down and grabbed the knife. She finished making her salad and sat down. Della had already left. She ate alone again.
“No matter what you do you’ll always be worthless.” The voice said.
Biana let herself cry. No one would care, they never did.
She put her dish in the sink and went to her favorite spot. She grabbed her book and her running shoes and went to a blooming purple tree. She sat beneath it and started to read. When the voice stirred she pulled on her shoes and ran. She ran a total of 30 laps that day trying to avoid the voice it still crept in.
“Why hide it when you know you're a mistake?” The voice whispered. She ran inside, grabbed some mallowmelt and ran to her room. She ate slowly at the slices, tears streaming down her face. The voice was relentless. When she finished her last slice she ripped off her tunic and leggings and turned on the shower. She looked into the mirror as the water heated up. The girl looking back at her had tear stained cheeks, her teal eyes looked slightly bloodshot. Her dark bags under her eyes could rival Edaline’s. And her chocolate brown hair was tangled. She stepped under the colorful spray of water and tried so hard to think good things about herself but the voice always won.
Biana got into bed once she was done with her shower and layed down. The glittering stars hanging from her canopy glittered a teal light. It was supposed to be calming but it just reminded her about her ‘perfect’ family and unrealistic expectations.
“You're worthless. You're a mistake. No one will love you!” The voice shouted.
Biana jumped out of bed ready to run again but instead she walked over to her desk and grabbed her imparter. She let out a shaky breath and hailed Elwin.
“Hi Biana.” He said, “What did you need?”
Biana’s tears spilled over as she told him about the voice and how neglected she’d been feeling,
“Have you told your parents?” He asked, turning away to wipe his own tears.
“I’ve tried.. . but Della doesn’t listen and Alsen and Fitz don’t talk to me.” She said as tears doubled over.
“Leap to Foxfire now.” Elwin said before he turned off the imparter.
Biana walked to the Leapmaster, 10,000, shouted, “Foxfire!” Then walked onto campus grounds. Elwin was waiting in the healing center.
“Elwin.” She said.
“Ah, Biana, come here.” Elwin replied.
Biana did so.
“What you told me matches with symptoms of severe depression so I whipped up something that should help a little.” He said as he placed a small container into Biana’s hand.
Biana’s voice failed so she walked over and wrapped Elwin in a hug.
“T.. . . Thank you.” She managed to get out.
Elwin hugged back and said it was nothing. But he didn’t know how much it meant to Biana. She had been neglected and alone for most of her life and the fact that someone cared was something huge.
writing_prompt: Biana has always been overshadowed by her perfect family, her struggles unnoticed and her voice unheard. But when the relentless whispers of self-doubt become too much, she reaches out to the one person who might truly see her—what happens next could change everything.

title: I Never State The Obvious (But That Doesn't Mean That It's Not There)
warnings: Choose Not To Use Archive Warnings, No Archive Warnings Apply
post_title:
Amity Blight was raised under high standards be the best don't state the obvious things people already know, how ironic that she's head over heels in love with Luz
Luz was raised under a castle roof high standards rules everything had to do with the rules I wonder how many were broken when she fell in love with Amity
Two girls love each other and when Luz accidentally confesses everything comes together
Maybe this will make you not want to kill me after reading the chapter Thanks to Them on Silver Mask, Broken Soul :') probably not
comment:
Amity loved Luz, more than she would ever admit. So when she saw Luz chopping off her hair she jumped at the opportunity to help. She loved discussing Azura with Luz who had such interesting insights including the fact that she also shipped Azura and Hecate. Amity wanted to give everything to Luz. She wanted to be there whenever she had another panic attack. She wanted to read Azura with her. So to say she was crushing on Luz was a major understatement.
—----
“Hey,” Amity greeted Luz who was curled up on a chair reading.
“Hey.” She said back,
That already felt like a win. Sometimes with Luz she would just remain silent or wave.
“So I had a question.” Amity started.
“What?” Luz asked,
“Why did you want to cut your hair so bad?”
Luz bit her lip and looked down at her hands with those obscure magenta eyes Amity had gotten lost in many times.
“You don’t have to tell me I was just curious.”
“I want to tell you I just- d- I don’t know how.”
“I’ve found it’s best just to blurt it out. No beating around the bush.”
Luz chuckled and Amity felt her face warm.
“Okay, I’m- it’s- I’m a grimwalker.” She choked out barely above a whisper.
“Oh Titan.” Amity cursed, “That’s a copy of a dead person right?”
“Yeah, how did you know?”
“I may or may not have read a few things while working at the library.”
Luz giggled a little but her smile faded.
“Please don’t tell anyone.”
Amity smiled, and mimed zipping her lips shut.
“So what does that have to do with your hair?” Amity asked,
“The girl I’m a copy of had the exact same length of hair as I did before I cut it after escaping the Empress’s mind.”
“So when it was growing out again it triggered you.” Amity guessed.
“Right.” Luz confirmed, “Speaking of hair when I first met you, you had green hair. Why the change?”
“Oh, green is what Odalia prefered since she was trying to make me her little doll.”
“It’s abomination colored right?”
“What?”
“You’re hair now, it’s abomination colored.”
“Yeah, only my dad has caught that. How did you?”
“Oh,” Luz started getting flustered, “Well you’re an abomination witch, abominations, purple, it just fit.”
Amity laughed and Luz’s face went red and she cracked a rare smile.
“You’re so brave.” Amity whispered.
“How so.” Luz said, genuinely confused.
“Well, you were in the Empress’s mind, found out all of this stuff and still kept fighting. Not to mention how amazing you were at fighting and at being the Silver Soldier. Then I’m just some doll, and a constant disappointment.”
“WHAT!? NO! You’re not a disappointment and you’re not a doll! You’re so pretty and cool and classy and I can’t believe you don’t realize that! You’re amazing Amity and I-” Luz cut herself off before she could finish that sentence. Her face went livid and she slapped her hand over her mouth. Amity’s face went tomato mode and hope filled her eyes. Luz ran out of the room.
—-----
Luz loved Amity, it was really easy to tell. She always stumbled on her words when she was around and could never stop thinking about a certain cotton candy haired goddess. She would do anything for Amity. But she wasn’t prepared to accidentally blurt out her feelings to her.
“HOLD ON! YOU DID WHAT!” Hunter yelled in shock.
“I accidentally confessed to Amity, and now she’s going to hate me!” Luz replied.
“IT’S ABOUT TIME!” Hunter practically screamed.
“You don’t get it Hunter, she’s going to hate me.” Luz cried burying her face in pillows.
“Luz, Amity isn’t going to hate you.”
“How do you know!”
“Luz tell me how did she react after you said all those things?”
“You know I’m not good at reading people Hunter.”
“Just tell me what was the look in her eyes?”
“You’re going to laugh.”
“Try me.”
“She looked….. .. …. .. . Hopeful.”
Hunter looked victorious as he left Luz’s room. Luz heard a few small knocks on her open door. When she looked up she saw Amity hiding behind an Azura book.
“I’m sorry for everything I understand if you hate me-” Amity started.
“WAIT YOU THOUGHT I WOULD HATE YOU!” Luz cried,
“YES!?”
“I THOUGHT YOU WOULD HATE ME!”
“WHY WOULD I HATE YOU?!”
“I DON’T KNOW?!!”
They stared at each other and laughed.
“What’s this?” Luz asked, gesturing to the Azura book in her hands.
“Oh, they just published Azura book 6, I thought I could use it as a peace offering.”
“THEY PUBLISHED AZURA BOOK 6!” Luz screamed happily.
“YEAH!” Amity also cried happily.
“Do you want to read it together?” Luz asked, shyly.
“I’d love to, but first,” Amity’s face turned pink, “did you mean all those things you said earlier?”
Luz’s face went supernova as she nodded, “I- I really think you're pretty and you’re so much braver than I am. I mean you stood up to your awful m-”
Luz was cut off by Amity’s lips pressing against hers. Luz was shocked at first but melted into it, she lifted her hand to cup Amity’s chin. Amity broke the kiss looking shocked at herself and fearful.
“Oh, crikey.” Luz breathed,
“I cannot believe I just did that.” Amity mumbled eyes still wide.
“I can’t believe I just said that! ‘Oh crikey,’ how did I even think that!”
Amity smiled and pressed her lips against Luz’s cheek, “I dunno I kind of liked it.”
Luz looked over at Amity grinning, “Alright then, shall we read Azura?”
“Yes we shall.” Amity giggled and they cuddled together on Luz’s bed and read Azura. Ghost and Stringbean curled up in their owners laps.
“Do you want to be my girlfriend?” Luz blurted,
“YES!” Amity practically screamed.
They grinned and their lips pressed together again to seal the deal.
writing_prompt: When Luz accidentally confesses her feelings for Amity, chaos, panic, and a lot of blushing ensue. Can two awkward witches navigate their emotions, or will their love story be as dramatic as an Azura novel?

title: How do we Make One Night Last Forever?
fandoms: Keeper of the Lost Cities Series - Shannon Messenger
warnings: No Archive Warnings Apply, Choose Not To Use Archive Warnings
post_title:
Sophie and Keefe both live at Havenfield (Keefe in the grove Sophie in the manor) so what if Keefe made her bring him human snacks and they end up having a grand ol' time
Human snacks and fluff here we go
💚💚💚💚💚
comment:
“Foster? Foster?” Keefe whispered straight into her ear.
“MmwhatdoUwaaanT.” Sophie said clearly still wanting to sleep.
She had set up outside under the Panakes tree again but she wasn’t expecting a certain blond boy to wake her up.
Keefe started tickling her and she snapped awake and gripped his wrist.
He smirked, “You look cute when you're angry.”
She blushed, “Shut up, tell me why you had to wake me up.”
“Can you blame a guy for wanting to bother a certain girl?”
“That’s not the real reason. Tell me.”
“Fine I just wanted to see you.. … .and I want human snacks.”
Sophie groaned, “Fine but it’s coming out of your birth-fund.”
Keefe jumped to his feet and clapped his hands excitedly. Honestly Sophie had to blush. It was adorable.
—-
So now they were standing outside of a Walmart after Sophie had teleported them. They had picked up Dex just so they could get human money but he went home straight after.
Keefe did a double-take between the store and Sophie. When Sophie nodded he practically bolted inside. Sophie walked in after him and grabbed a shopping cart. Keefe was already in the snack aisle when Sophie walked into it. He was looking at pretty much every label on the snacks and practically screamed in delight when he saw some packs of E.L Fudges.
“Grab them, if you want them.” Sophe said through a yawn.
He didn’t just grab one he grabbed ten. Sophie face-palmed and grabbed a bucket of cheese-puffs. Keefe grabbed: three different types of goldfish, eight fudge stripes (only because of the elf on the packaging), four packs of chips-ahoy, and six packs of circus animals. Whereas Sophie grabbed: four oreo packs, a pack of Hostess cupcakes, and a bag of pretzels.
They went to the self-checkout (mainly to avoid questions about where their parents were) and started scanning. Keefe insisted on scanning the E.L Fudges but gave up after the tenth try. Sophie gave him a sympathetic smile and scanned the barcode. Keefe’s jaw dropped as she got through all the snacks (and some Snickers from the shelf next to the self-checkout) in less than twenty seconds.
They leaped back to Havenfield as soon as they were out of sight.
—--
They sat underneath the Panakes tree and Keefe immediately dove into the E.L Fudges.
“Save some. You're going to want more later.” Sophie warned as she opened a cupcake.
It was nothing compared to mallowmelt but it was still delicious. The cream center was slightly questionable after all this time without snacks like this but she still ate it.
“You know, I never thought I’d eat human snacks under a Panakes tree. What about you?” Keefe said after six cookies.
“Definitely not.”
“If I had thought about it I’d be very happy though.”
Sophie laughed, “Yeah me too.”
She opened the bucket of cheese-puffs next. The cheese powder stuck to her fingers after just brushing the puffs.
“What are those?” Keefe asked, pointing to the cheese-puffs.
She laughed again, “Cheese-puffs, want some?”
As if he needed an invitation he had already stuffed seven into his mouth at a time. They opened the Chips-Ahoy next.
“These are pretty dry aren’t they?” Keefe said,
“Definitely, but I think it’s just a human cookie thing.”
Oreos came next. Again they were kinda dry but the cream definitely helped. Sophie definitely saw Grady and Edaline looking out the windows a few times. Parents.
“This is the best thing I’ve put in my mouth.” Keefe said after stuffing a cupcake into his mouth.
“I doubt it’s the ‘best thing’ but they are pretty good.”
The fudge stripes, according to Keefe, “were just knock-off E.L Fudges.” Sophie had tried to explain that they were made by the same people but he didn’t listen. At this point everything had been opened and several wrappers and snacks littered the grass.
Sophie shoved some pretzels into her mouth as Keefe fidgeted with a Snickers bar.
“You know, I think this might be the best night ever.”
“It has been pretty awesome.” Sophie agreed.
“I mean human snacks and Sophie Foster, how could it get better?”
Now Sophie was blushing. The light from the moon illuminated the blush too.
Sophie yawned. Keefe brushed some cheese dust off the corner of her mouth.
“I don’t think I’d have a good night without you.”
“Don’t give me all the credit. You're the one who forced me to take you to Walmart.”
“I still don’t get why they call it Wall art.”
“Walmart, Keefe and you're changing the subject.”
Keefe laughed and looked straight into her eyes, “Even if I hadn't woken you up it would've been awesome since I got to see you.”
“You’re so cheesy!”
“Not as cheesy as these things.” Keefe gestured to the now mostly empty bucket of cheese-puffs.
Sophie threw a pretzel at him and it got stuck in his hair.
“You want to start a snack war Foster?” He said arming himself with the Snickers bar held out like a sword.
They laughed it off. They looked at each other and pressed their lips together. Keefe’s lips moved from her mouth to the spot between her neck and ear. Sophie moaned elation filling her. Their lips met again and Sophie pulled them closer together, wrapping her arms around him. Keefe added a delicate nibble to her lower lip. She shivered in a good way and let it keep going. Dang she’d never stop loving him. They broke apart.
“How about that snack war?” Sohe asked. Tossing another pretzel into his hair.
Keefe grinned, “Oh it is so on!”
Snacks flew for around ten minutes. Neither of them remembered falling asleep under the tree, but they did. Neither wanted the night to be over. But even the best things come to a close. That doesn't stop anyone from wondering how they can make one night last forever.
writing_prompt: When Keefe wakes Sophie up in the middle of the night with a craving for human snacks, their adventure to Walmart turns into a chaotic, snack-filled night under the Panakes tree—complete with laughter, confessions, and an impromptu snack war.

title: The Only Person I Need
fandoms: Keeper of the Lost Cities Series - Shannon Messenger
warnings: Choose Not To Use Archive Warnings, No Archive Warnings Apply
post_title: The Neverseen have been defeated, Sophie's biological parents came out so she could be no longer unmatchable. This is Sophie's Winnowing Gala
comment:
Tonight was Sophie’s Winnowing Gala. She let out a deep breath and got ready. For her gown she chose an ice blue one with lace but not too many frills. The sparkles and swirls along the bodice were beautiful. And it wasn’t a problem that the gown was her latest favorite color. She had Vertina walk her through makeup and a simple updo tying her hair back with ice blue ribbon. She also spritzed some of her Panakes perfume on. Before she walked out the door she studied her first list, dragging her fingers along name one. Then she walked out the door and into the pasture Grady and Edaline had set up for parties.
She met up with her adoptive parents and saw the proud grins on their faces. It had been months since they had beat the Neverseen but they never stopped being proud.
“You ready kiddo?” Grady asked, looking like he really wanted to cancel and send her to her room, not ready to let her grow up.
Sophie sighed, “As ready as I’m going to get.”
Edaline just gave her a squeezing comforting hug then she went onto the dance floor. She looked around for him, and when she spotted him her heart melted. Keefe was dressed in a brown jerkin with gold leaf patterns. Their eyes met and Keefe walked toward her.
“Well Foster, may I have this dance.” He said with a smirk.
“You may.” She decided to play along.
As she danced with Keefe she could feel Fitz, her number 11, staring, or maybe glaring would’ve been a better word, at them.
Sophie sighed, “He always does that when we're together.”
“I know,” Keefe said,”but don’t let him get to you.”
The two continued to dance, stopping only to get some food. They grabbed some cake and when no one was watching they ran up to the pasture with Calla’s Panakes tree. They sat, backs against the smooth braided bark of the tree.
“Well you sure know how to party, Foster.” Keefe said with a wink.
“Urg I hate this I only went through with it so Grady wouldn’t kick you out the moment you step foot at Havenfield.” Sophie muttered.
“Ha! He can try, I'm not leaving my girlfriend for that long.”
Sophie gasped and blushed. They’d been dating for months but they hadn’t really used those titles yet. And they weren't just dating because of matchmaking, though that was a welcome bonus considering Keefe was her number one and she was his number one.
“You okay?” Keefe said, after she stayed quiet.
“Yeah, it’s just….um..”
“You weren’t expecting me to use the word were you?” Keefe said after Sophie stopped.
She blew out a breath, “Yeah, I mean it’s not unexpected but….I didn’t expect it.”
“I know, I can feel it.”
Sophie sat up and looked straight at Keefe, “Is this a recent thing or…”
“No, I mean I’ve felt flickers for a few days but. Flickers aren’t normal.”
“KEEFE! Why didn’t you tell me!?”
“Because it still wasn’t normal, like I said they were just flickers.”
“Hmm you have a point. But as penance I’m making you a shirt that says ‘Brown eyed elves give me all the feels.’”
“Ha! Smooth.” Keefe laughed.
“I learned from the best.” She told him with a playful shove.
Keefe hadn’t had his empathy back to normal in months. He’d been trying so hard to get it back up and now it just suddenly does?...
“How do you think it started?” Sophie asked as they turned their play fight to snuggling.
Keefe blew put a breath, “I’m honestly not sure.”
“Well at least it’s working.” She pointed out.
“Yeah.”
They looked down at the pasture seeing the glowing lights of the party.
“What do we do know?” Sophie asked after a moment of silence.
“I don’t know, but I do know one thing.” Keefe said
“What?”
“You're the only person I need.”
Sophie blushed. Then when she thought about it she saw it from Keefe’s perspective. He had to grow up in an awful tower with parents that not only didn’t love him, though Cassius does just burys it, but a mother who was a leader of the Neverseen. While Sophie had grown up in a loving human home, then when she moved to the Lost Cities and amazing adoptive family. Not to mention the biological parents who, once the Neverseen were defeated, came out specifically to help Sophie out of her matchmaking pit.
She leaned over and kissed Keefe lightly.
“What was that for.” He asked after she leaned back onto the braided bark.
“I dunno just felt like I should.”
He smiled, “Liar.”
Sophie grinned, “I can’t be good at everything.”
“Mmmhh.” He said they tirned their gaze back to the glowing lights.
Grady and Edaline had spotted them. Edaline gave mushy grins while Grady, looked like he wanted to grab Sophie and drag her back. But he didn’t which probably had to do with Edaline’s arm in front of him. She rolled her eyes, parents. She thought.
Keefe gently pushed her chin towards him, “Hey, we said we weren't going to hide remember.”
“Yep.”
They both leaned towards each other. Leaving a tiny space. At the same moment they brushed their lips together. Brushing turned everything new. Keefe’s lips went into the nook beyween hers and his hand went up to cup her chin. While Sophie wrapped her arms around his abdomen, brushing along his body. When they broke away they were both smiling. And when they looked down at the party Grady looked desperate to run up there, but Edaline had him pinned.
The two laughed and kissed again. This time Keefe went directly for the nook adding a delicate nibble. Sophie embraced it. She tried to dig deeper in enjoying the beautiful moment and never wanting it to be over. Keefe’s hand went up to the side of her head cradling it. Sophie put her arms around his shoulders and neck area bringing them closer. When Keefe pulled away their forheads still connected. Sophie leaned in to the little nook between his head and neck resting there. While Keefe pulled her closer leading them to not even be an inch apart. Their hands entertwined and they sat their. Feeling Calla’s songs in the air and having two teenage alicorns running around them. They soon fell asleep neither breaking apart. And for the moment Sophie didn’t have any worries. She knew Grady was still fighting Edaline to break them up. She knew the possibility of the Neverseen escaping their individual prisons was a possibility. But she just stayed in the moment. Keeping her thoughts here under the Panakes tree where she and her boyfriend were snuggling.
One last sentence from both of them at the same time, “I love you.”
writing_prompt: At her Winnowing Gala, Sophie finds herself caught between the expectations of her adoptive family, the lingering stares of an old flame, and the quiet, unwavering support of Keefe—her number one match and the boy who always seems to know what she needs before she does.

title: Alone in a New World
fandoms: Keeper of the Lost Cities Series - Shannon Messenger
warnings: Choose Not To Use Archive Warnings, No Archive Warnings Apply
post_title: Keefe's adventures in the Forbidden Cities ends just before the events of "Soulmates"
comment:
As Keefe stepped into blue light he looked back at Grady with one thought that he didn't dare voice, “I love her.” He took one last step and disappeared to the Forbidden cities.
—-----
It took Keefe days of light leaping to finally reach London. And as soon as he stepped out of the light he was bombarded with human emotions overwhelming his sensitive empathy. Tears took to Keefe’s eyes as he tried to find the quietest corner in the busy human city. He considered leaping home but it was too late. Keefe knew one of Forkle’s cameras had caught him on the few days he stopped leaping for a little while. If he came back his mom would surely hurt Sophie to hurt him again. So he kept forward.
Keefe did his best to ignore the sharp pain going through his head as the emotions of the humans flooded his mind. He had the hood of the cheap blue hoodie, he hadn’t given back to Fitz when they ran away to the Black Swan, covering his trademark hairstyle and face.
“Keep walking.” He told himself as a clear new blade of pain shot through his head. The small bag he had brought was blowing slightly in the wind as he walked.
He got to his location, a large hotel, rather quickly after a rather hard talk with one of the locals. The longer he didn’t talk the scarier it got. He walked inside to be bombarded with floral decorations.
“Well, it looks like humans have an even worse obsession than elves.” He said under his breath as he walked up to the desk.
“Here to get a room.”
“Okay, does room 405 work?” The woman at the counter asked him.
“Sure.” He pulled out the money he had made when he sold his mother’s jewelry.
The lady took the money, eyes wide, and handed him the key. Keefe walked up the stairs trying to shut off his empathy the way Sophie had described how she shut off her enhancing. But it didn't work, the emotions were just as strong. He got to his room and surveyed the area.
“More flowers. Fantastic.” He said as he saw how the room was decorated.
Finally he changed into simple light blue pajamas and got into the bed. The blankets were coarse compared to the gnomish beds he grew up with, and the cushioning was even worse, but most of all it didn’t feel like home. Then he drifted into an uneasy sleep.
He was alone, darkness wrapped around him and shortly a flashing light hit the crown on his head. Confusion turned to pain, and pain turned into an intolerable nightmare.
Sleep, his mind whispered, that's what he wanted. But when someone else's mind whispered back, “okay sleep.” His mind closed off into a section of him he didn't recognize.
Keefe woke up sitting up quickly, sweating severely. His heart was racing as he tried to convince himself, “Nightmare. It was just a nightmare.” But he wouldn’t believe it. Mrs. Stinkbottom had fallen to the floor but when he squeezed the stuffed gulon it didn’t help as much as he needed. So he pulled himself out of bed and went to the small bag he had packed, fingering a small metal object the imparter Grady had made him take.
He held the object to his mouth and whispered, “Show me Grady Ruewen.”
Grady’s face appeared seconds later. He looked weary but okay. He soon asked, “What's wrong Keefe?”
“I.. .” He couldn’t find the right words.
Grady seemed to realize so he went on, giving Keefe updates and assuring him that Sophie was fine. He had just worked up the courage to ask Grady, “How does she deal with nightmares?” When he heard the front chimes signaling that someone was entering the Havenfeild manor. Grady said a quick goodbye and turned off the impartr leaving Keefe back to the empty room.
Keefe started deep breaths trying to shake off the nightmare. But it wasn’t a nightmare, and it was no coincidence he had it. This was the first time he had actually slept since leaving the Lost Cities, knowing that the experience in Loamnore would haunt him. The nightmare was a replay of every horrid painful feeling that had occurred.
Since the nightmare wasn’t going to leave him, Keefe focused on changing. Pulling on the black Batman shirt he had also not given back. Just touching it made him feel better. Remembering how much Foster had cared, how much she helped him. It was like having her back for a few moments. He soon added dark blue jeans and simple black and white tennis shoes. He lingered in the bathroom staring at his reflection. He hadn’t really seen himself since before Loamnore. And he didn’t like what he saw.
He looked at the mirror and saw a miserable boy. His hair unstyled and his smirk gone. He remembered teasing Foster about near death experiences and nightmares and he saw a hypocrite. Someone who had gone through the experiences, and still teased her. He also had started having the haunting images of the nightmare in the back of his head. His photographic memory, betraying him.
He stared at the reflection and left the room before even touching the hairbrush.
—-----
It was the fourth month in Humanland. Nightmares haunting him every night. He kept trying to block the human emotions but nothing worked. Eventually he just turned numb. He woke up sweating from the nightmare and from the bombardment of emotions and something switched. Something he couldn’t control, something he couldn’t turn back on.
Eventually when he had to get air, he stepped outside. He went to the library where Mr. Wright had died with his daughter. Where his mom had killed them. Nothing triggered. He stopped by a small flower shop, bought small forget-me-nots and walked to the cemetery. He dropped the flowers by the two graves and left. He walked for hours that day trying to find the green door. But it was gone. He went back to the hotel and started drawing in his green journal. He drew the scene he had done that morning, the two graves with the forget-me-nots. He tucked the notebook away, changed into his pajamas and prepared for another horrible night.
Keefe woke up. It wasn’t the usual waking up sensation, where sweat trickled down his face and his heart raced. Instead it was steady and he heard a knocking at the door. He jumped up and walked towards the door and opened a crack. When he saw the familiar beautiful face and looked into her brown eyes his smirk returned and he soon whispered, “Foster.”
Then Sophie lunged and tackled-hugged him.
“Um, not that I’m not happy to see you Foster but how did you find me? Also at some point I’m going to need to breathe.” He had meant the words but just seeing Sophie again was like taking a deep breath for the first time.
“Sorry!” She immediately said letting go of him.
“Don’t apologize!” Keefe told her sternly, “I had a feeling you would strangle me if I saw you again.”
“You really weren't planning on coming back. Were you?” She asked, looking sad as she said it.
Keefe blew out a breath, “I.. .---”
He was interrupted by Bangs Boy piping up, “Don’t we have a job to do?”
“Right,” Sophie said quickly, “So Tam, do you want him to stand or sit or.. .”
“Hang on Bangs Boy is doing what now??” Keefe interrupted.
Sophie gave him a brief explanation about a shadow ripple thing that Umber had put in his heart. Telling him that, that was how they had found him. Even explaining Vespera’s deal and the strange power source.
“Wow.. .” He said, confused and shocked.
“So.” Sophie said turning back to Tam, “Should he sit er?”
“Sitting might be wise.” Tam finally said.
Keefe sat down on one of the many chairs in his hotel room and stared at Tam, “What now?”
Keefe was answered by Tam’s shadow crawling across the floor to Keefe’s feet.  Tam lifted his hand and then retracted it sharp and hard. Keefe suddenly felt like King Dimitar had, yet again, sliced open a deep gash under his rib cage sharp pain flaring as soon as Tam made the motion. Then a shadow slithered away and Tam lifted it with his power and held it there.
“Done.” Tam said, sweating.
“Are you okay?” Sophie asked Keefe. He had started clutching his chest and rubbing the spot with his scar.
“Yeah but that pull was like getting kicked in the ribs.” It was true but it wasn’t even close to the pain that had actually occurred, but Keefe didn’t want to remind Sophie about the sparring match.
“Sorry, I was worried that if I palled for longer it would drag out the pain.” Tam soon said.
“Yeah it probably would have.” Keefe said while shrugging, “Thanks.. . um. Huh I can’t think of a non weird way of saying, ‘thanks for removing the creepy shadow ripple thing from my heart’”
Tam grinned, “You're welcome.”
“What do we do now?” Dex finally said after a few moments of silence.
Tam was still holding the ripple so Keefe suggested, “Here put it in this way when it goes out with the garbage, if it still somehow works, it will lead my mom to a pile of trash.” He said tossing Tam an empty plastic water bottle.
Sophie smiled but it looked a bit forced.
“Foster this power source you told me about. We HAVE to destroy it. I don’t care if it's going to help me, we need to make sure my mom can never get her hands on it.”
Sophie nodded, but Keefe knew that wasn’t enough. He stood up and went to the bedroom section of his room.
“Where are you going?” Sophie called.
“To get my stuff I’m coming with you!”
writing_prompt: After months of hiding in the human world, haunted by nightmares and overwhelmed by emotions, Keefe is finally found by Sophie and the gang. But as they remove a dangerous shadow ripple from his heart, Keefe realizes there’s a greater threat looming—one that only he can help stop.

title: Along The Road We Have Each Other
fandoms: Keeper of the Lost Cities Series - Shannon Messenger
warnings: Choose Not To Use Archive Warnings, No Archive Warnings Apply
post_title:
HUMAN AU KOTLC!!
Including lots of Sokeefe :3
*WARNING*
This is my very first au fic so if that will make you cringe I apologize
comment:
Sophie sat in the rain. No umbrella in sight. When she looked up she saw her older sister, Jolie, offering her an umbrella, smiling, Amy is behind her. Sophie takes it gladly but doesn't smile. It's hard to smile when you're in pain.
—--------
Sophie and Amy were adopted by Grady and Edaline, two rich parents who loved them as if they were their own flesh and blood. Jolie was biologically related to their parents and was 17 whereas Sophie was 15 and Amy was 12.
“Sophie, it's time for school!” Edaline called from downstairs.
Sophie groaned High School sucked.
“Sophie, it won't be that bad.” Edaline said gently, shaking her shoulder when she came in.
She gave Edaline a dubious look and joined Jolie at the table.
“C’mon Soph it can’t be worse than yesterday.” Jolie said sweetly.
“Then you and I have different definitions of ‘worse.’” Sophie said,
Amy came downstairs shortly after and immediately grabbed four fresh butterblasts.
“Save some for the rest of us Me-me.” Jolie said, playfully shoving Amy.
“If you want some, grab some.” Amy shot back.
Sophie laughed and grabbed four of her own.
“Well I guess I’m outnumbered.” Jolie laughed and grabbed the last four.
Amy left with Edaline to go to school soon after, Jolie and Sophie left for the bus stop minutes later.
“Soph about last night-” Jolie started.
“I don’t want to talk about it.” Sophie interrupted.
“What did they do?” Jolie asked.
Sophie sighed, “They said it was my fault that Amy’s and mine parents died.”
Jolie stopped and glared, “Why.”
Sophie shrugged, “They're just jerks, I'm over it.”
“You can’t lie to me Sophie.”
The bus showed up that moment and Sophie practically bolted to her seat next to Marella and Dex.
“Hi Sophie!” Dex said a little too loudly.
“Morning Dex, Marella.” Sophie said.
Marella nodded. She was a quiet pixie-like girl. Whereas Dex was loud and fairly tall. Sophie was kind of the middle person, not loud but not quiet, not tall but not short.
Fitz and his Football friends chatted loudly in the back seat. Dex rolled his eyes, mumbling “Wonderboy” under his breath. Marella had similar sentiments but Sophie was indifferent. He was a boy, there wasn’t anything especially annoying about him unlike Keefe Sencen. Sophie had never met him but all the teachers said he was trouble, so she did her best to avoid him.
They got off the bus quickly and Sophie practically ran to her locker; she was too late. She had known since the year started that Keefe Sencen’s locker was right next to hers. But normally she can beat him there today was different. And for extra joy she lost her schedule, so she had no clue where she was going. She started toying with the lock as Keefe kinda watched her.
“What do you want!” Sophie said after five minutes.
Keefe jumped back a few steps startled. Before he could reply Stina walked behind Sophie and knocked everything Sophie was carrying onto the ground.
Stina cackled, “Sophie Foster you cluts how could you drop everything?”
Sophie blushed; embarrassed. And started picking up her stuff, only for it to be knocked out of her hands again.
“What the heck!” Sophie heard Keefe shout.
Stina looked shocked, “It was her clumsiness not me.” She protested.
Sophie kept her head down.
“Are you brain dead? I watched you knock her stuff. What is wrong with you?” Keefe continued.
Stina rolled her eyes and signaled for her minions to follow her, “I’m putting her in her place Sencen and worry about yourself.” Then she walked away.
Sophie worked on picking her stuff up again but all of it was collected and being handed to her by Keefe.
“Are you okay?” Keefe asked when Sophie didn’t take the things Stina had knocked out of her hands.
“What’s the ulterior motive!” She snapped.
Keefe looked confused, “Um there is none, just take your stuff.”
Sophie blushed and grabbed her things but as she turned to walk away she heard him call, “If you want to know the motive here it is: Stina was bothering you so I tried to help!”
She turned around fuming, “Leave me alone I don’t need another Stina.”
“Did I or did I not stop Stina?”
“Oh please I know what you do; you're the prankster, the one who’s always in detention.”
Keefe looked hurt, “I really was just trying to help.” He said.
Sophie sighed, “I’m sorry most people don’t like me so I just expect it.”
“Why do people not like you?”
Sophie shrugged, “You're guess is as good as mine.”
“I noticed you lost your schedule.” Keefe noted changing the subject.
“Yeah, what’s it to you?”
He smirked, “Elwin has all of the students' schedules, so he knows where you're going after you visit him.”
“I don’t know my way to his office.” She mumbled.
“That’s an easy fix, follow me.”
And surprisingly she did.
“Here we are!” Keefe announced as he opened the door.
Elwin looked up from his desk and laughed, “That explains the dramatic entry, what do you two need.”
“I lost my schedule.” Sophie mumbled.
“And you Keefe.”
“Just helping out a fellow student.”
In no time Sophie had her schedule and she found herself wanting to be near Keefe. When he started walking to his class she ran to catch up.
“Let’s compare schedules.” She suggested. And Keefe looked relieved and happy as they did so.
And they found that most of their classes were the same.
“This way Foster on to Chemistry!” Keefe declared.
Sophie laughed and blushed as she took his hand.
They spent the whole walk talking, exchanging phone numbers, telling jokes, and just overall being friends. When they got to Chemistry Sophie groaned, “I’m terrible at Chemistry.”
Keefe laughed, “Just do whatever Dex does, that's my strategy.”
“You know Dex?”
“Not personally but he’s the Chemistry wizard.”
“Ahem!” Mrs. Galvin said loudly, “Unless you would like to share with the class, sit down.”
“Why should we? We can learn just as well standing!” Keefe countered.
“That’s another week of detention Mr. Sencen and one for you to Miss Foster.” Mrs. Galvin declared.
“It’s Foster-Ruewen.” Sophie said, annoyed.
“Another week Miss Foster.” Mrs. Galvin said again.
“No seriously, my last name is Foster-Ruewen!”
“Foster-Ruewen, it is now time to sit down and stop telling fairy tales.”
“I’m adopted my original last name was Foster, but now because of my adoptive parents it’s Foster-Ruewen!” Sophie tried to explain.
Mrs. Galvin just sighed, and Sophie sat down defeatedly.
“Nice argument.” Keefe whispered.
“I was just trying to fix my name. What's so wrong with that?” She whispered back.
“Everything is bad with Mrs. Galvin.”
“Mr. Sencen and Miss Foster Principle Alina’s office now!” Mrs. Galvin shouted.
Sophie’s eye twitched and as she and Keefe walked out she yelled, “My last name is Foster-Ruewen.”
They didn’t go to the principal's office, instead they ditched until their next class.
“Two days a week with her is going to be a nightmare!” Sophie groaned.
“I know right she’s evil.” Keefe said laughing.
Sophie groaned again.
“You didn’t tell me you're adopted.” Keefe said after a moment of silence.
“Yeah, it’s not the first thing I tell people.”
“What happened?”
“Both my parents died in an accident and my little sister and I were adopted by the Ruewen’s.”
“Oh, wow.”
“Yup.” Sophie said, trying to end the conversation and kicking the wall.
“I’m sorry.” Keefe said.
“It happened a few years ago, it's fine.”
“Time doesn't make it better or worse.” Keefe argued.
Sophie had ignored him at this point and focused on counting the bricks in the wall.
“Foster? Ffffffoooooossssssttttteeeeerrrrrr!?” Keefe said right in her ear.
“Gah! Keefe what!” Sophie said, rubbing her ear.
Keefe laughed and Sophie did too.
“Just making sure you were listening.” Keefe said through laughs.
“I wasn’t to have you know.” She said defiantly.
Keefe just kept laughing.
They ended up doing this a lot through their High School years. It brought Sophie’s mood up a lot then their senior year Keefe asked her to Prom.
“Me? Why me?” Sophie asked after he dropped the question randomly.
“You're my best friend and I’d rather be at a dumb party with my friend than be at my house.”
“I’d love to, it just shocked me.”
Keefe grinned, “Fantastic I’ll meet you at your place?”
“Yup, but be warned about my dad you should’ve seen him when Brant asked Jolie out.”
Keefe laughed, “It’s worth it.”
Hours later Jolie is helping Sophie get ready, Biana along for the ride. Biana and Sophie had become friends when they both made fake excuses to go to the Healing Center instead of PE, one of the few classes she had without Keefe.
“Red, red is definitely her color.” Biana argued.
“No gold it’ll bring out the highlights in her eyes.” Jolie said.
Sophie sat on the bed watching them argue.
“She’s going with Keefe red will make her look extra striking.” Biana countered.
“Their going as friends gold is the obvious choice, much less bold.” Jolie argued
“Guys!” Sophie interjected.
They both looked at her.
“What if you mix them?” Sophie asked.
Jolie and Biana did a double take between each other and Sophie.
“LET'S DO IT!” They both yelled.
Jolie and Biana had put together an outfit that consisted of a simple red dress with a gold waistline and cuffs, with red ribbon for her hair glittered with gold sequins, and a gold eyeliner. For shoes they chose red flats with gold bottoms.
“Wow.” Sophie breathed as she looked in the mirror even Jolie’s best friends, Vertina, looked shocked.
Jolie and Biana fist bumped each other. Then the doorbell rang and Sophie sprinted to beat her dad to the door. When she opened it Keefe smiled at her then his jaw dropped as she opened the door fully.
Keefe was wearing a simple black suit with gold highlights.
Sophie smiled, “Hey Keefe.”
“Hi,” he said, still awestruck.
Before they could leave Grady gave the “dad talk” for 258 seconds, and yes Sophie counted, to Keefe.
Sophie and Keefe walked to the High School just chatting. Keefe commented multiple times about how Sophie looked.
When they got there Marella was dancing with Linh under the stars, Tam practically stalking them.
Keefe and Sophie said hello and walked inside.
“What do you want to do?” Sophie asked Keefe.
“Dance obviously Foster.” He said as he dragged her onto the dance floor.
It didn't take long before Keefe got her invested in the music and they danced for a while. When the slow started they ran off to the concessions table.
“Hey Foster, do you like anyone like Marella likes Linh?” Keefe asked.
Sophie laughed, “Nothing I can think of off the top of my head. You?” She lied.
“Just one girl that’s the only detail I’m giving.”
“C’mon Keefe give me one hint.”
“Okay,”
Then Keefe’s lips pressed against hers. Sophie fully embraced it pulling them closer. Keefe’s lips went into the continent nook between Sophie's, adding a delicate twist. Sophie was the one who pulled away smiling.
“I lied, I've had a crush on you since you took me to Elwin’s office that first day.” Sophie said as Keefe studied her.
Keefe laughed, “Me too Foster me too.”
—------
Years past and Sophie and Keefe hadn’t seen each other in those years. Sophie had gone to Yale on a full scholarship while Keefe hadn’t gone to school yet.
Sophie was sitting in the small cafe she worked at washing cups. It was a slow day and no one had come in. It was Sophie’s senior year and she smiled at the memories she made while here. Many men tried to pursue her but they were rejected each time. There was only one boy she loved. Even though she hadn’t seen him in years. She was in the back when the door swung open.
“Be there in a moment.” Sophie called as she set the cup down. “How may I help you?” Sophie asked as a familiar looking girl stood at the counter.
“I need a Pumpkin Spice Latte right now.” She said, “And make it snappy Sophie Foster.”
“Stina Heks, I thought I recognized you. I’ll get your order right away.” Sophie said.
But when Stina grabbed the Latte from Sophie she clutched it too hard on purpose spilling it on the counter and on Stina.
“Ahh look what you’ve done Foster!” Stina screamed.
Before Sophie could respond a male voice interjected, “Back to the same stunts are we Stina? Aren't we all adults here?”
Stina snapped around, “Of course you would ruin my fun Sencen.”
Sophie threw off her apron and ran towards Keefe. When she got to him Keefe pulled her into a tight hug.
“Missed you too Foster.” Keefe said softly.
Apparently Keefe had gotten into Yale for an art major and had started about two years ago.
“Why didn't you tell me?” Sophie complained.
“Missed me badly didn’t you?” Keefe said, smirking.
Sophie blushed, Keefe smirked wider and a universal law was returned.
They got married a few years after that. They lived in a small house with three bedrooms. Their daughter’s name was Ranai. She had blond hair and ice blue eyes with flecks of gold.
“She’s so small.” Sophie whispered.
“She really is.” Keefe agreed.
“You're going to be the best dad.” Sophie said.
“Are you sure I don’t know anything about this kinda stuff.”
“You know plenty and you're funny, caring, what wouldn’t she love about you?”
“I can think of a lot of things.”
“Don’t think about your parents, they were bad people but you're not them.”
“Well you are already the best mom.”
Sophie laughed, “I’ve had two mom’s in my lifetime, it’s easy to see how awesome they were and are.”
“You're biological parents must be so proud.”
“Maybe, I hope they do.”
Time went by fast before Sophie knew it Ranai was graduating High School. When she went to college she still stayed at home.
“Honey I’m-” Sophie started.
“Shhh.” Keefe then showed her that Ranai was asleep, head covered by a book and drooling on the table.
They looked at her lovingly. And remembered how small she used to be.
Sophie died in her sleep at age 93 Keefe at 94. Even when they left the mortal plane of existence they watched over Ranai who had kids of her own.
“And that’s where my story ends.” Sophie finished.
writing_prompt: After losing her parents and being adopted into a new family, Sophie struggles to navigate high school, bullies, and her own insecurities—until an unexpected friendship with the notorious prankster Keefe Sencen changes everything.
